bibl.title: Report: Mosquito Control Work in Barranquilla, by L.H. Dunn, [1923]

div1.p: Dunn reports on his survey of the city of Barranquilla.

div1.head: Report: Mosquito Control Work in Barranquilla, by L.H. Dunn, [1923]
div1.p: Report of first complete Inspection of City.

The first complete inspection of the City of Barranquilla was
completed on Nov. 23rd, 1923, with the following findings:-
Approximate number of houses in city..................12025
Number of houses visited..............................10635
Number of houses found closed......................... 1390
Houses in which mosquito breeding was found........... 5502
Percentage of houses in which mosquito breeding was
found.................................................51.73
Water containers examined:-
Wells, holes in patios, etc...................... 178
Tanks, cisterns, etc............................. 2875
Barrels, tinajas, etc.............................30515
Total containers..................................33568
Average number of containers per house............... 3.15
Water containers in which mosquito breeding was found:-
Wells, holes in patios, etc....................... 65
Tanks, cisterns, etc.............................. 748
Barrels, tinajas, etc............................. 9139
Total containers with mosquito breeding.......... 9952
Percentage of water containers with mosquito breeding.29.64
Barrels examined..............................10200
Barrels with mosquito breeding.....................3404

Each house having two or more separate apartments, with
different tenants occupying each apartment, is classed as
two or more houses in this report. Thus a three family house
with three tenants is included as three houses.
div1.closer:
L. H. Dunn.
Entomologist and Supervising
Inspector.
